Class Odometer

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      Odometer
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class Odometer
extends java.lang.Thread

An odometer class which runs its own thread to monitor the wheel rotation and update the position information every 10 ms.

THREAD SAFE

Nested Class Summary
static class Odometer.Position
          Represents an immutable position with a heading (x, y and theta).

Constructor Detail

Odometer

public Odometer(lejos.nxt.NXTRegulatedMotor leftMotor,
                lejos.nxt.NXTRegulatedMotor rightMotor,
                FilteredLightSensor leftLightSensor,
                FilteredLightSensor rightLightSensor)
Constructs a new odometer from the left and right motors of the robot and the light sensor for correction (can be null if this won't ever be used).

Parameters:
leftMotor - The left motor
rightMotor - The right motor
leftLightSensor - The left wheel orrection light sensor
rightLightSensor - The right wheel correction light sensor
Method Detail

enableCorrection

public void enableCorrection(boolean enabled)
Whether or not to enable the position correction using the light sensor. Do not enable this if the odometer was constructed using null light sensors.

Parameters:
enabled - The enable state

enableDebugOutput

public void enableDebugOutput(boolean enabled)
Whether or not to enable the debug output: the odometer position will be mapped to the Display to "ox", "oy" and "ot". When crossing a horizontal line, a low pitch sound will be played. When crossing a vertical line, the sound will be higher pitched.

Parameters:
enabled - The enable state

run

public void run()
Runs the odometry code.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
Overrides:
run in class java.lang.Thread

setPosition

public void setPosition(float setX,
                        float setY,
                        float setT)
Sets the position to 3 specified values

Parameters:
setX - float, the new x position
setY - float, the new y position
setT - float, the new theta position

getPosition

public Odometer.Position getPosition()
Returns the current x, y and theta as a position object.

Returns:
All the position information
